tweet:
If Mitch McConnell spent half as much time defending our elections as he has on defending himself, our democracy would be a lot safer.

@senatemajldr – do your job. Let the Senate vote on election security legislation. This is bigger than politics. It's about national security. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1156197780496560128 …

Great meeting yesterday with local immigration advocates in #NY04. I had a chance to discuss my recent trip to the border and our efforts to address the humanitarian crisis there.

I'm so grateful for the strong partnerships I have in my community around this critical issue. pic.twitter.com/vQyFKKf7M2

Finally, 9/11 first responders and families will have the support and peace of mind they deserve. So grateful to everyone who made this possible, especially the brave men and women of the FDNY and NYPD, who fought harder and sacrificed more than anyone. https://nwsdy.li/2MmZ1JX

Hundreds of kids and parents came out today for @EnesKanter's free basketball clinic in #NY04!

Such an incredible experience. 

I could not be more grateful to Island Garden for hosting us and to Enes for everything he does for kids across the country! Keep up the great work! pic.twitter.com/HmNB3c6om7

No one cares what party you belong to when you’re stuck in traffic. It’s time we finally put partisanship aside and improve American infrastructure.

My colleagues in the @NewDemCoalition and I wrote a letter to @POTUS urging him to do just that.  http://bit.ly/2K8gQtQ  pic.twitter.com/3Flg776c0M

I've been to the border and I've seen the conditions in which migrants are being kept.

Yesterday I was proud to vote for @CongressmanRuiz's Humanitarian Protections for Individuals in CBP Custody Act, which will provide critical safeguards. I urge the Senate to pass it quickly. https://twitter.com/CongressmanRuiz/status/1154367709188169730 …

It was wonderful having him lead us in prayer on the House floor, where he delivered a much-needed message of unity and love. #NY04 pic.twitter.com/77TWkjnrbL

These kids deserve this opportunity. 

Stay tuned for an update. #NY04 https://twitter.com/EnesKanter/status/1154187743100100609 …

Once again, Mueller laid out extensive evidence of obstruction by the President and made it clear that the President hasn't been exonerated.

An OLC opinion may prevent Mueller from holding Trump accountable, but it shouldn't stop Congress.

We must begin impeachment proceedings.

This cannot be overlooked.

At this point in the last Presidential election, Russia already hacked the DNC. 

There's no question they're targetting our upcoming elections right now.

And every day that McConnell blocks election security legislation, he becomes more complicit. https://twitter.com/ZekeJMiller/status/1154101627667865600 …

.@RepTedLieu: "The reason again that you did not indict Donald Trump is because of an OLC opinion stating you cannot indict a sitting president, is that correct?"

Mueller: "That is correct.

This exchange speaks for itself.

BDS will not help achieve a lasting peace between the Israeli and Palestinian people. In fact, it moves us further away from reaching a two-state solution and only serves to delegitimize our ally Israel. Today I was proud to vote for H.Res.246 which opposes this harmful movement.

Too many of the first responders who fought for this bill's passage were not here today to see it happen.

James Zadroga, Ray Pfeifer, Lou Alvarez and many more.

They gave everything they had to get us here. They are our heroes and we owe them everything. https://twitter.com/SpectrumNewsDC/status/1153756814049271810 …

Great news! The Senate just passed our bill to permanently authorize the 9/11 Victim Compensation Fund!

Now onto the President’s desk. We won’t stop until this gets done.

Our heroes deserve nothing less.
#Renew911VCF

In the last week, we've learned of at least 2 American citizens who have been detained by CBP/ICE.

The administration's immigration policies are clearly broken. But Trump is only doubling down by expanding expedited removals, which will certainly lead to more unjust detentions. https://twitter.com/KannoYoungs/status/1153696715561717763 …

On our trip to the border last week, @RepBarragan helped secure the release of a 13 y/o American citizen being held by CBP.

Now we're learning of another citizen who's been held by ICE for 3 weeks & denied due process. This needs to stop. Francisco must be released immediately. https://twitter.com/dallasnews/status/1153621280425480192 …

A flash flood warning is in effect for Nassau County during today's morning commute.

Please be careful, drive safely and stay off flooded roads! https://twitter.com/NWSNewYorkNY/status/1153626744294973446 …

I won't stop working until we find the right solution to this crisis. But until we do, I urge every Member of Congress to visit the border and see this situation for themselves — because the decisions we make in Washington affect people's lives down here. 7/7 pic.twitter.com/K6isZWXdjm

That means we need to make the right investments to help people at the border while maintaining oversight over DHS to ensure resources are used appropriately. It also means making greater investments in Central America to address the factors that have forced so many to flee. 6/7

We cannot turn our backs to those fleeing violence and persecution. It's simply not an option. That's not who we are as a country. Instead, we need to identify both effective and humane strategies for addressing this crisis.

Those two things are not mutually exclusive. 5/7

The truth is, this administration continues to push many policies like MPP that are hurting migrants, endangering asylum seekers and exacerbating the humanitarian crisis.

If we want to find a solution, then these cruel and legally questionable practices must end. 4/7

We also learned yesterday that @DHSgov will begin implementing MPP (Remain in Mexico) in the RGV region. Metering and MPP have put thousands of migrants and asylum seekers in a perilous and dangerous position on the other side of the border. 3/7 pic.twitter.com/1QPPe7EVRi

At several @CBP facilities, we saw hundreds of migrants, including kids, being held in overcrowded and unsanitary conditions for prolonged periods. It was gut-wrenching.

This is no way for vulnerable people to live, especially when they're in the care of the U.S. government. 2/7 pic.twitter.com/YmVpR5I9vk

We just wrapped up our bipartisan visit to the Rio Grande Valley with @HomelandDems.

While this was a productive trip, it was also very difficult. 1/7 pic.twitter.com/i5ePmqjbFp

It should not have taken a visit from a Congressional delegation to rectify this.

And what would have happened if we hadn't shown up today?

This process is broken. https://twitter.com/RepBarragan/status/1152359133330444288 …

Please remember to drink water, stay cool and check-in on your neighbors.

This week, we lost two more heroes to 9/11-related illnesses. Firefighters Richard Driscoll and Kevin Nolan. My thoughts are with their families, colleagues, and friends.

We can’t afford to wait any longer. We need the Senate to #Renew911VCF once and for all. Lives depend on it. https://twitter.com/rollcall/status/1151956068240674816 …

I'm on my way to McAllen, TX with @HomelandDems as part of a bipartisan delegation. We'll be examining migrant conditions at various @CBP facilities following disturbing reports of overcrowding and prolonged detention.

We'll provide updates on our oversight throughout our visit.

House Democrats made a promise to raise wages for American workers. Today, we delivered. 

I’m proud to have voted for the #RaiseTheWage Act, which will gradually increase the federal minimum wage to $15/hour and give up to 33 million Americans a much-deserved raise. pic.twitter.com/zqsLj0H5qf

Women who work for tips in states with a tipped minimum wage are twice as likely to experience sexual harassment.

The #RaiseTheWage Act isn’t just about providing economic security, it’s about eliminating dangerous workplace conditions for millions of women. #OneFairWage

Yet another example of how this administration has distorted @DHSgov's mission and turned it into a political tool. 

Instead of allowing @USCIS to address its staggering backlog, leadership is asking career civil servants to enforce Trump's cruel, anti-immigrant agenda. https://twitter.com/Haleaziz/status/1151560718791008256 …

Following disturbing reports of abuse at a @HHSGov-contracted shelter on Long Island, @RepTomSuozzi, @RepEspaillat and I are demanding answers regarding the agency's oversight of the facilities responsible for housing undocumented children.  http://uni.vi/TBCz101G8kg

37,000 air noise complaints were made to @PANYNJ in May 2019.

That's more than DOUBLE the number made in May of 2018.

Something needs to change. It’s time for the FAA to consider the people on the ground. pic.twitter.com/VLrjCqmgcO

There was nothing offensive or even subjective about the Speaker's words.

She stated a fact. The President's comments were racist.

We will be a better country when every Member of Congress has the courage to call out bigotry regardless of what side of the aisle it comes from. https://twitter.com/CraigCaplan/status/1151210594722357248 …

This is the longest period in history without an increase in the minimum wage.

That's why this week, the House will vote on the #RaisetheWage Act, which will gradually raise the minimum wage to $15 and lift 1.3 million Americans out of poverty.

It's time to pass this bill.
